title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB:
When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. This issue can be reproduced by following these steps:

1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information.

After performing these steps, observe that there are no children nodes listed in the data set editor. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor in the query tab.
4. Change the data source for the data set.
5. Verify that the children nodes are listed correctly in the data set editor.
